definitions.definition: a thin, flat piece of cut wood or other hard material, often used for a particular purpose:
examples: Cut the vegetables on a chopping (US cutting) board.

definitions.definition: a flat piece of wood or other hard material with a special pattern on it, used for playing games:

examples: The teacher wrote her name up on the board.
I stuck the notice (up) on the board.
I dived off the top board today, Dad.

definitions.definition: the wooden fence surrounding the ice surface in ice hockey
to get onto or allow people to get onto a boat, train, or aircraft:
examples: At London airport she boarded a plane to Australia.
